definitions.text: the state of being free of suspicion
examples: investigation showed that he was in the clear

definitions.text: a clear or unobstructed space or expanse of land or water
examples: finally broke out of the forest into the open

definitions.text: make a way or path by removing objects
examples: Clear a path through the dense forest
The sky cleared after the storm
The rock star never authorized this slanderous biography
clear the leaves from the lawn

definitions.text: be debited and credited to the proper bank accounts
examples: The check will clear within 2 business days
The fog cleared in the afternoon

definitions.text: pass by, over, or under without making contact
examples: the balloon cleared the tree tops

definitions.text: make free from confusion or ambiguity; make clear
examples: Clear up the question of who is at fault

definitions.text: free from payment of customs duties, as of a shipment
examples: Clear the ship and let it dock

definitions.text: clear from impurities, blemishes, pollution, etc.
examples: clear the water before it can be drunk

definitions.text: earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages
examples: How much do you make a month in your new job?
She earns a lot in her new job
this merger brought in lots of money
We cleared a lot of the old model cars

definitions.text: pass an inspection or receive authorization
pronounce not guilty of criminal charges
examples: The suspect was cleared of the murder charges

definitions.text: make clear, bright, light, or translucent
examples: The water had to be cleared through filtering
clear the patrons from the theater after the bomb threat

definitions.text: free (the throat) by making a rasping sound

examples: a clear indication that she was angry
gave us a clear idea of human nature
a complex problem requiring a clear head
not clear about what is expected of us
the air is clear and clean

definitions.text: free from contact or proximity or connection
examples: we were clear of the danger
the ship was clear of the reef

definitions.text: characterized by freedom from troubling thoughts (especially guilt)
examples: regarded her questioner with clear untroubled eyes

definitions.text: (of sound or color) free from anything that dulls or dims
examples: efforts to obtain a clean bass in orchestral recordings
a light lilting voice like a silver bell

definitions.text: (especially of a title) free from any encumbrance or limitation that presents a question of fact or law
examples: I have clear title to this property

definitions.text: clear and distinct to the senses; easily perceptible
examples: the letter brought back a clear image of his grandfather
a spire clean-cut against the sky

definitions.text: free from clouds or mist or haze
free from flaw or blemish or impurity
examples: the clear complexion of a healthy young woman

definitions.text: freed from any question of guilt
examples: was now clear of the charge of cowardice

definitions.text: characterized by ease and quickness in perceiving

examples: read the book clear to the end
there were open fields clear to the horizon
could be seen clearly under the microscope
